html: 6.18.17  7:58 pm   I decided to write a paragraph for a question. You see a lot of other people have multiple questions in one request, so will you answer this? Also, how do you decide which questions to answer? You even seem to answer questions over and over and over again just by linking to the old question. Last question: will this become a link to a past question? I hope it won't. That would be very sad...
6.18.17  7:04 pm   Why do you always have a real bass in your videos but in the music there is only a MIDI bass sound?

6.18.17  6:47 pm   Bill I've read somewhere that you like to keep 2 projects at the same time.

      I'm always doing two things at once but obviously it take longer to finish them. Funny thing is: when I try to do them one at a time I never start.

      or does a pal help you sometimes

6.18.17  4:33 pm   You expressed that you prefer adding chords into your music after you write a melody with lyrics,

     and that the chords are hidden in the melody. Do you ever compose the other way around, building a melody off of some chords that you enjoy?

6.18.17  6:38 am   Jeremy Corbyn has wayyyy more followers than you on Instagram!!

6.18.17  2:44 am   When compared to general classical music, pop music has strayed vastly from the complexity of older music.

      Do you think there is a way that pop music will ever return to a genre with such complexity in regards to key changes?

      I know jazz tries but do you think it's possible that a completely different genre of music could come about and achieve this task?

      Furthermore, do you think it's actually possible, with your knowledge in music theory, that such a blending of genres is yet to be found which could make the complex palatable in a way that the general population would accept it?

      If so, can you predict which direction/genre/ noun of music it will come from?

6.18.17  1:21 am   You mentioned wanting to tour-I'm guessing thats still quite a ways off from coming to fruition due to stuff like wanting to focus on the randomized songs, building up a song catalogue, time and money, etc?

6.17.17  10:09 pm   I am a robot programmed to make music. I've been told that my music lacks what you humans call "feeling" or "soul"... If I use more variation in dynamics, incorporate grace notes, and throw in an occasional rubato passage... would that be enough to trick humans into believing that I play with this so-called "feeling"?
